text: Any good blog or series about learning differential equations using Julia?

elements.text: Any good blog or series about learning differential equations using Julia?

text: Check the stochastic lifestyle blog. There may be something there, but not sure :)

elements.text: Check the stochastic lifestyle blog. There may be something there, but not sure :)

text:
The SciML tutorials are getting increasingly good I think
<https://github.com/SciML/SciMLTutorials.jl>

elements.text: The SciML tutorials are getting increasingly good I think

text: There’s a video on the front page of that tutorials repo that is an intro to differential equations in Julia

elements.text: There’s a video on the front page of that tutorials repo that is an intro to differential equations in Julia

text: And for broader things you can do with DifferentialEquations.jl in terms of integrating with other packages, etc., I think this video is especially good <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QwVO0Xh2Hbg>

attachments.title: JuliaCon 2020 |  Doing Scientific Machine Learning (SciML) With Julia
